title: What movie sequels have absolutely none of the original cast? - Quora

response.answer_text: After a pretty decent (although I believe widely misunderstood and yes, almost completely unrelated to the book) opening for the franchise Starship Troopers, they decided that (A) audiences were primed and ready for more, and that (B) none of the stars of the original movie were apparently the cause for the first one’s success. The first one was populated by the likes of Casper Van Dien, Denise Richards, Jake Busey, the ALWAYS stellar Clancy Brown and Neil Fucking Patrick Harris. So they rushed out this steaming load, which took a whopping month and a half to make it to video, so barely avoiding the direct-to-video label although that’s pretty much what it was:  No one returned. Neither did the vast majority of the fans. Sitting right now on a big ol’ 33% on Rotten Tomatoes. I think that might be a tad generous.
Did you see the three-part Atlas Shrugged based on the long Ayn Rand novel? It’s all one story and they do have ANY of the same cast in any of the three episodes. Very freaky to watch on acid.
